have fun.
Words and songs are the most important.
Thank you for your time.
Thank you.
I'm so happy.
This is the line.

Yanagisawa, you're going to have a
little...
It's a little...
It's a little...

Yes.

I like Western music and hard rock.

So I've been playing hard rock since I
got my mind.
With a loud volume?
It's a good exercise.
I thought it was annoying.

Since then, I've had a lot of
opportunities to touch music.
Thanks to that, I've really liked music.

I thought about what was in the CD,
cassette, and record in the house.

I've been able to pull it out and get my
father to teach me a lot of things.
I've been doing that since I was little.
Did your father teach you?

My father is someone who teaches me even
without listening to it.
He would say, listen to this.
He would play the Zeppelin.
My father liked the Duke Purple a lot.

The Duke Purple was playing all the
time.

He saw me, who was a little interested
in Duke Purple's music,
he started to play music a lot.

He played hard rock like Red Zeppelin or
Black Sabbath.
From there, he became quite a maniac.

He played other genres, such as Uriah
Hip and Mountain.
He played a lot of those genres.

I didn't think, this is like this, this
is like this.

But from that time, I had the
opportunity to play various kinds of
music.

I was able to experience the music in a
way that I was interested in.

It wasn't about the music, but the
presentation of the guitar.

The presentation of the guitar, the
phrase, the feeling of the song, etc.

But I was listening to that, so I became
very interested in music in a Korean
way.

I was able to experience the song by
myself.

Did you have any chance to sing
seriously?

Or did you have any chance to form a
band?

I told Yonagisawa that I wanted to form
a band with this band.

I asked Yonagisawa if there was anyone
who could sing.
He invited me and I joined.
I just joined.
How old were you when you joined?

I think I was in my last year of high
school.

I'm the younger brother of Fujiwara
Yanagisawa,
and he's one of my younger brothers.

When Yanagisawa was in the second year
of high school, and I was in the third
year of high school,
we became like this.

I imagine that Shibuya's singing is
amazing,
so I ask him to sing.
Originally, the bassist, Uesugi,
is the father of the band Super Beaver.
He's still, from the beginning,
Shibuya is...
He had something unique.

I don't know what it is, but at least he
didn't have anything for himself.

He was a person who had a single true
path.

He was a person who had a world that
only Shibuya and Ryuto knew.
That's the reason why he was invited.
Uesugi said that a lot.
The appearance is also...
It was quite distinctive at the time.
What was it like at the time?
It was like a self-released cut.

Just thinking about it makes me want to
come out right away.
I wanted to dye my hair,

and I wanted to raise my piercings as
much as I could.

I didn't have a place to stand when I
was lost.

I jumped up, but I was like, I'm going
to go.
If I stand out, something will change.
If I stand out, I'll be popular.

Shibuya-san, you chose a song that had a
big influence on you.
You pushed for the song, I can't do it.
I really thought it was impossible.
That's right.
I'm going to do it myself.

I chose a song that made me interested
in music and started to act.

I chose a song that made me start to dig
various things.

This time, I chose a song called 氷のマニキュア
by Tatsuro Yamashita.
The first CD I bought was Off Course.

I really liked Off Course and I listened
to it because I thought it was great for
me as an elementary school student.

When I started listening to various
things at home, I found Koji's album.
When I listened to it, I was excited.
This feeling is...
I've never felt this before.

I wanted to know the roots of
excitement,

so I tried to find my way around various
things.
I lived with only what I had at home,

but I couldn't live with what I had at
home.
That's why I chose Tatsuro Yamashita.
Why is Tatsuro-san's voice so...
It's connected to your thoughts.

I can tell now, but he's a very
particular person.

He's a great musician and a great
singer, but I think he's a musician now.

At that time, I didn't know anything,
but it was blurred.
I'm sure even children understand it.
I was excited about it.
I was very shocked.
From then until now.
I've been listening to it all the time.
At the same pace.
At the same pace?
How fast is it at the same pace?
I don't think it opens for a day.
It doesn't open.
I don't think it opens for a day.

I have a good voice.
Great.

No.

No.
You don't?
No.

that's no-touch.

You're a real music fan, so you're a

I'm just a musician.
When I went to the concert...
・Y kişi ・Y?!?

I went there without permission.
I have a sense of duty.

When did you go there for the first
time?
It's been over 30 years.
I went to see it.
I was there for three hours.
I felt three hours was short.
It was my first time.
It's a blessing.
I can be so moved.

I was so happy that I thought I was
going to die.
We had 100 concerts a year.

There are moments when I feel like I'm
going to die.

And when I saw the concert without
thinking about it, I suddenly felt like
I was going to die.
I really like it.
I'm going to play it.
I don't have any idea what's amazing.
Oh, you don't analyze it?
Not at all.
I'm always looking forward to it.
I'm always talking.
I'm talking.

I don't even know if I can call you a

That's amazing.

I'm happy.
I'm really happy.

I was a guitarist when I was a child.
My father was a guitarist.
Did you feel like you were being taught?

I told my father that I wanted to play
the guitar.

He bought me a guitar and taught me the
C chord.

I was a guitarist when I was in the

I was close to Brian because I was close
to him.
I was playing at home all the time.
I didn't like it very much.
I felt it was natural to play it.
What kind of music did you play?
I played hard rock,
and also blues,

Smoke on the Water.
I was taught when I started playing.
It's simple and cool.

And the Beatles are better, but you

That was when I was in elementary
school.

I was listening to a lot of songs at
that time.

I started listening to songs when I was
in the 4th grade.

I asked my mother to buy a CD of the
song, Grey's However.
Where did you hear that?
Why are you laughing?
You're in shock.
Where did you hear that?
I heard it on a music program on TV.
It's a good song for a child.
Grey's However
I remember that I was really impressed.

I was in the 4th grade of elementary
school,

and there was a girl who knew a lot

I went to her place and only remember

And the title was in English, so I
couldn't remember it.

I was saying however, however, and then
I went home.
That's a shock.
That's right.

I didn't know that I'd become a fan of

Yanagisawa.
What is it? I'm scared.

I'm going to ask Takuro to send me a

I'm very grateful.
Are you doing well?
Yes.

I'm very happy to have someone's memory

I'm a little proud.

And I'm grateful that I'm still active

YANAGISA, the world is still in a state
of anxiety, but we are musicians.

Let's work hard to warm the hearts of

I look forward to the day we can meet
again.
Takuro.
Isn't it amazing?
This is amazing.

I'm already on the show, so I'd like to

I'm so happy.

if I actually do this in the band, it
